title: Manchester City To Reignite Interest In Defender With £55 Million Offer
text:
Manchester City To Reignite Interest In Defender With £55 Million Offer Mon Feb 06 2017 09:27:28   09:27:28   
Manchester City's attack is looking better than ever, surprising considering that Sergio Aguero hasn't been in the team, but their defence still looks a little shaky and Pep Guardiola wants to fix that in the summer. 
During the match against West Ham last week and for the first half against Swansea yesterday Guardiola's team have looked like the side that won the first 10 games of their season. 
At that point a lot of people thought City might casually wander away with the title. However form fell away and their defensive frailties became all too clear to see. 
Earlier this month they shipped four goals to Everton so unsurprisingly the addition of Gabriel Jesus does not solve all of their problems. 
However Guardiola wants to fix their defensive issues and according to the the Sun he'll do that in the summer with a £55 million move for Athletic Bilbao's Aymeric Laporte . 
The former Barcelona manager is clearly a fan of Laporte's and tried to sign him in the summer, as well as his successful move for John Stones, but had a £38 million move turned down by Bilbao. 
Since then the young Frenchman has signed a new contract which has a release clause for £55 million and despite already spending around £50 million on one 22 year old defender that doesn't put Guardiola off signing another 22 year old. 
City were linked with a move for Southampton's Virgil van Dijk in the January transfer window but the Saints have put a £50 million price tag on the former Celtic player that Guardiola thinks doesn't represent the player's value. 
Could Laporte one day be in our All Time Spanish Premier League XI? 
In previous years City have spent £40 million on Eliaquim Mangala and around £35 million on Nicolas Otamendi, as well as the money for Stones, with none of those players yet living up to their price tags. 
Guardiola will be as determined as ever to get his defensive recruits right in the summer with Vincent Kompany's long term future at the club becoming increasingly shorter. Sponsored Links
